body:
Hi Randolph,
		I use an Ocean Optics USB 2000+ spectrometer. It incredibly samples
every 1/3 of a nanometer. I particularly appreciate the SpectraSuite
software needed to drive it. Very useful to determine CCT etc. You can use
MGF tools to convert its text data into a Radiance format. I also
purchased a reference lamp module to keep it calibrated. Used it today in
fact, to sample a 97+ CRI LED.


Here are a few lines from a lamp file..
.
.
419.34	1.51324047E-6
419.71	1.52070443E-6
420.08	1.58661166E-6
.


.




Rob Shakespeare






On 9/20/12 7:10 PM, "Randolph Fritz" <rfritz at lbl.gov> wrote:
___
